title: Problem: Azure listChunkSize is not configurable
body:

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

In one of my instances, Rclone fails to list the cointainer files when using --fast-list.

I was able to work around this by changing the default value for [listChunkSize](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/master/backend/azureblob/azureblob.go#L39) from 5000 to 1000 (tried 2500, but also failed in this host) and rebuilding rclone.

It would be nice to have this as a command line option.

#### What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)

rclone v1.42
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.10.1

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

Ubuntu 16.04 64 bits

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

Azure

#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
rclone sync -v --fast-list /path-to-folder azure-rclone:container --backup-dir azure-rclone:container-changes/$(date +%Y)/$(date +%m)/$(date +%d)-$(date +%H%M%S)
```
